actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and title II of the Social Security Act to provide an elective exemption from social security taxes for individuals who are 65 years of age or older.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Working Seniors Equity Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code and the Social Security Act to allow working individuals age 65 or older to elect to be exempt from social security taxes. Excludes work performed by such individuals after 70 years of age from employment for purposes of the tax on employers. Provides for recomputing such individual's base years for Old-Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance purposes.

titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and title II of the Social Security Act to provide an elective exemption from social security taxes for individuals who are 65 years of age or older.
